Or you could always just rename the existing database in tearDown using
the=
 name of the running test-fixture. Then in setup, you always start
with a n=
ew fresh database. This way, at the end of the test, you can
examine the da=
ta left after any test run without needing to branch your
logic.

R.

maybe this can help try to subclass Test=
Case

import junit.framework.*;

public class YourTestCase extends TestCase=
 {

    public void runBare() throws Throwable {
        super.runBare();  =
  
        tearDownNoError();
    }

    // This teardown  will run only if=
 no error or failure occurs   
    protected void tearDownNoError() throws =
Exception {
    }
}

Inherit your test from 'YourTestCase" and not from sta=
ndard TestCase.
Extract parts from tearDown() to tearDownNoError() that you=
 would like
to run only 
if no error or failure occurs in setup, test or te=
ardown. 

Jan
